title.narrative: Ukraine: SME development / Azov Sea / UNDP

description.narrative:
The project aims to boost the current support to entrepreneurship development, jobs creation, business skills advancement and accessing markets in the conflict-affected environment, helping to improve resilience of local population affected by the conflict and prevent further deterioration of the economic situation in Donetsk and Zaporizhzhia regions along the Azov see coastal line of Ukraine.
The project address major obstacles to business start-up and scale-up holistically, by providing local conflict-affected population including women, youth and IDPs with access to information, access to skills and networks, access to finance and access to expanded national/international markets.
Beneficiaries are people formerly employed in heavy industry, mining, ports and fisheries, rural population (in particular along the coastline), existing small enterprises in the coastal regions, who will become more organized and productive and better understand their development needs, think up new business strategies and capacities. Focus is on provision of support to unemployed people, particularly formerly employed in ports and fishing industry, existing agriculture and non-agriculture MSMEs, as well as start-ups, cooperatives and farmers associations.
